intro: Gymnostyles mutisii, commonly known as the Andean evergreen, is a shrub native to the Andes Mountains. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves. The plant produces small, white to pink flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Gymnostyles mutisii thrives in moist, shaded environments at high altitudes. Its botanical features make it an important species in the study of Andean flora.
